sense.name: evoke an emotion or a response
sense.examples: Emylie elicited fear because she's kind of mean and scary. The professor elicited respect from her students. The break up elicited strong sadness from the young girl. Brutal attacks elicit retaliation from opposing forces. Finals elicit stress from all overworked students.

sense.name: draw out information
sense.examples: Students elicit information during lecture. Linguists elicit sentences for analysis. The young children were eliciting answers from the teacher. The army elicits information through interrogation. The video elicited a plethora of answers for the trainees.
